name: ListEventRules
description:
Fetches all event rules under a specified ruleset.

This tool retrieves all the event rules associated with a given ruleset in Pagerduty. Use it to view the actions defined for handling events. Note that rulesets and event rules will be phased out, so migrating to Event Orchestration is recommended.

parameters.name: ruleset_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the ruleset to retrieve event rules for.

parameters.name: accept_version_header
parameters.description: Specifies the version of the API to use by setting the 'Accept' header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Specifies the format of the data being sent. For this endpoint, use 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Defines the number of event rules returned per page. Use this to control the volume of data in each response.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset for starting pagination of search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the `total` field in pagination responses, providing the total number of results.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
